is written in uk terms and is suitable for beginner crocheters upwards with a simple single row repeat the scarf of possibilities produces a lovely wearable item quickly you can make a straight scarf a doubled cowl or a mobius scarf yarn used i used 71g yarnsmiths lagoon dk in marano grado and 75g yarnsmiths create dk in parchment measurements 19cm deep x 144cm circumference on my doubled cowl *yarn amounts will vary depending on what you make and your gauge most testers used 150g of dk but one made a single mobius scarf and used 75g of dk pattern note ch2 at beginning of a row does not count as a stitch the pattern repeat is three stitches making it easy to increase or decrease the width as desired by adding or reducing by multiples of three chains gauge seven clusters x seven clusters in 10cm one cluster is one double_crochet and two treble_crochet abbreviations chain chain double_crochet double_crochet single_crochet usa treble_crochet treble_crochet double_crochet usa st/sts number of stitches repeat- repeat tools 4 5mm crochet hook or the hook size you prefer for dk yarn scissors and yarn needle copyright © 2025 @crochetscot please do not claim this pattern as scarf of possibilities pattern chain 36 on 4 5mm hook r1 2 treble_crochet in 3rd chain from hook *skip 2 chain 1dc 2tr in the next chain repeat from * to last 3ch skip 2 chain 1dc in the last chain ch2 and turn 2tr 11 clusters 1dc = 36 sts r2 2 treble_crochet in first double_crochet *skip 2 treble_crochet 1dc 2tr in next double_crochet repeat from * end by skipping 2 treble_crochet 1dc in the space between the final treble_crochet of the row and the ch2 ch2 and turn 2tr 11 clusters 1dc = 36 sts repeat row 2 until desired length achieved for the doubled cowl and mobius scarf this should fit comfortably around your neck twice for a long scarf stop at the length you d like your scarf to be factoring in if you will add fringe or not i changed colour after 46 row fasten_off and join the ends if you are creating the doubled cowl or mobius scarf for the mobius scarf twist one end of your scarf before joining to create the twist see photo you can join the ends by crocheting them together
